question.text:
Given below is a representation of a very important process in the construction of a biomolecule.
Choose the correct statement about this process from the following.

options.text: In this process, a polypeptide chain is broken down into its amino acids.
This process takes places in the ribosomes where the tRNA carries the amino acids as per the mRNA sequence.
The bases of the DNA are duplicated and new copies are formed.
DNA is transcribed into new mRNA which will further take part in protein synthesis.

solution.text:
Translation is process found in the protein synthesis amino acids are polymerised to make a polypeptide chain. The order and sequence in which the amino acids joined is determined by the sequence of bases found in the transcribed mRNA. This occurs in the ribosomes where the tRNA brings the amino acids as per the sequence.

This is what is represented in the given image of question. Replication is a process where DNA is duplicated and new copies are made. Transcription is the process of making new mRNA from DNA which will later participate in the protein synthesis- translation. Respiration is the process of breaking down glucose to generate energy in the form of ATP.
